title: Rumble Ball as Proto-Awakening
theory: The Rumble Ball stimulates a form of Zoan awakening, allowing Chopper to access forms beyond the standard three Zoan transformations. This could explain why no other Zoan users have attempted to use Rumble Balls - Oda might be saving this concept for a major revelation about Zoan awakening mechanics.

evidenceSupporting: Rumble Ball allows access to forms beyond normal Zoan limits

communityReception: Mixed - some fans find it plausible, others think it's a separate mechanic

title: Chopper's Forms Represent Different Human Subspecies
theory: Each of Chopper's transformation forms represents a different subspecies or variation of humans in the One Piece world. Horn Point represents giants or oni, Monster Point represents ancient giants, Kung Fu Point represents specific fighting-focused humans, etc. The Hito Hito no Mi might not grant a generic 'human' form but access to multiple human variations.

title: Why No Other Zoan Users Use Rumble Balls
theory: Fans theorize that Oda is deliberately keeping Rumble Balls exclusive to Chopper because he's planning a major reveal about why other Zoan users can't or won't use them. Possible reasons include: incompatibility with non-Hito Hito fruits, extreme danger for most users, or a future plot point about Chopper creating modified versions for allies.

title: Hiriluk's Research Contributed to Rumble Ball Development
theory: Some fans speculate that Chopper's ability to create the Rumble Ball was partially inspired by or built upon Dr. Hiriluk's medical research. While Hiriluk focused on healing hearts with cherry blossoms, his unconventional approach to medicine may have influenced Chopper's creative pharmaceutical innovations.
